who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside.`` Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/China.html"> China policy a year ago,`` Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus.`` Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaKen Auletta by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. book details the behind-the-scenes stories of Michael Vick 's surviving dogs and the influence, resilience, dedication and commitment of the animal behavior experts, animal-care groups, lawyers and government officials that united to save them. I didn't interview Michael Vick for this book because to me the story was more about what happened afterwards, which was an amazing thing, says Gorant.`` At the very core of the story is the human-animal bond that affects and inspires us all.''
